alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Ouachita (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Caldwell and southwestern Ouachita Parishes through 430 PM CDT... At 355 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Columbia, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Riverton, Luna, Vixen and Bosco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
